timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Returns the class that references the symbol. If the symbol is a method or a field,
          
          
            
               * Returns the class that contains the symbol. If the symbol is a method or a field,
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: Not 100% sure, but I think "references" is clearer. "contains" sounds more to me like the class where the symbol is defined.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: This return value is the class file where the incompatible symbol is defined.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
is expected to contain
(since it doesn't contain the symbol, and that's the problem)
replies.author: elharo

timeline.bodyText: This link is outdated. Would you update to https://jlbp.dev/glossary.html#linkage-error?
timeline.author: suztomo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,8 +23,7 @@
 import javax.annotation.Nullable;
 
 /**
- * A missing or incompatible symbol. This constitutes the cause of a linkage error (without the
- * source class).
+ * A missing or incompatible symbol that causes a linkage error.
  *
  * @see <a
  *     href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-opensource-java/blob/master/library-best-practices/glossary.md#linkage-error">

timeline.author: suztomo
